word_mean: 特异体质：任一个体身心所特有的习惯和特征
特〔异反〕应性：个体对某些药物、蛋白质或其他物质异常敏感，产生特异反应

sentence.Network_en: The book is a gem of Victorian idiosyncrasy.

sentence.Network_en: It was his idiosyncrasy to seem much older than his years.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的特点是看起来比实际年龄苍老得多.

sentence.Network_en: Eating no meat was Amy's idiosyncrasy.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (originally in the sense 'physical constitution peculiar to an individual'): from Greek idiosunkrasia, from idios 'own, private' + sun 'with' + krasis 'mixture'

entry.tran: (个人特有的)癖好，嗜好;(物品的)特色，特点
entry.def: If you talk about the idiosyncrasies of someone or something, you are referring to their rather unusual habits or characteristics.

example.ex: Everyone has a few little idiosyncrasies...
The bike has style, it has looks, it has its little idiosyncrasies...
example.tran: 这辆自行车品质一流，外观漂亮，有一些细节之处与众不同。

means.word_mean: 1. a behavioral attribute that is distinctive and peculiar to an individual

stems_affixes.value_cn: 惯用的,合乎语言习惯的
stems_affixes.word_buile: idiom[n.习语;成语方言;[艺术等的]风格,特色]+atic表形容词→adj.惯用的,合乎语言习惯的
idiot[n.白痴;极蠢的人;笨蛋]+cy表名词→idiocy愚蠢
idio自己的+gloss词语,语言+ia病→自由自己懂,别人不能理解的语言

stems_affixes.value_cn: 个人签名,[组织等的]标记,签名,商标[注意与ideograph区别]
stems_affixes.word_buile: idio特殊的,个人的,自己的+graph写,图→个人写的,个人[或特殊图标]图标→标记,签名,商标
idio特殊的,个人的,自己的+lect说→个人说的话

stems_affixes.value_cn: 习语;成语方言;[艺术等的]风格,特色
stems_affixes.word_buile: idio特殊的,个人的,自己的+m→特殊的语言
idio特殊的,个人的,自己的+syn共同,综合+crasy状态→个人特殊综合症
idio特殊的,个人的,自己的+ot人→idiot特殊的个人→白痴

means.word_mean: (某人特有的)气质, 习性, 癖好

sentences.en: I adjusted to my husband’s many idiosyncrasies.
sentences.cn: 我适应了我丈夫的许多习性。
